Huh, now that I think of it, that is probably why I don't use those two kind of tanks together ever. Also I don't really like the fact that some tanks has some fuel pipes on it and doesn't look right when using above one another (of the same type). This also applies for textures that can not be repetitive by the way.

Its just paint, a rocket flies just fine with a bad hair... errm paintjob..

Now what IS an issue, and one i am about to rage over, is the floating landing gear on some tank parts.

Thats a serious issue people, how can we land any vehicle safely if the gear float in front of them.

THis is totally against safety regulations, and i think we should hold the developers, for this responsible.

Our Kerbals allready take Huge risks here, and now we impose even a greater risk upon them as nessesairy, just because someone at HQ is to lazy to redo the mountplating of the landinggear.

Maybe after some lawsuit they finnaly will listen and fix this huge risk to the health of our beloved Kerbal.

As 0.24.2 shows us, Funds is what makes things tick, so removing Funds by lawsuit should get the attention this problem needs, and

for that fund we can compensate the Kerbals who suffernt injuries or worse due catastrophic landinggear failures..

If I understand you correctly, if you hold Shift in the VAB and use the directional keys, you only rotate (I think) 5 degrees at a time in any direction. It is a stock function.

I use it a lot on cramped craft with lots of parts and to line up hatches with natural obstruction free 'corridors' on very large ships.

Alt plus right click duplicates a part/assembly.

list of key bindings:
